quest.name: Blood of Emerald
journal: Cid's investigation in Terncliff has led to startling revelations.
Returning to the camp at Porta Praetoria, the Resistance officer informs you that your presence is required in Terncliff. As always, your escort stands ready to accompany you on the journey.

Terncliff is much the same as you remember from your previous visit, and while the imperial troops may be long gone, their enormous steel structures still mar the otherwise pleasant surroundings. Gaius and his associates have been made to wait for your arrival, as Cid would prefer to reveal his findings only when all of the relevant persons are present.

The investigation into the imperial facility in Terncliff has led to the discovery of the name of the VIIth Legion's third Weapon: Emerald. However, none of the locals have sighted anything resembling a large warmachina being moved from the town either by land or air. Though you cannot be certain, it seems likely that the Weapon was transported by sea, possibly to Castrum Marinum or Castrum Occidens in order to complete its construction. You and Gaius elect to investigate the former while Severa and Valdeaulin head for the latter. A member of the Ironworks has been ordered to prepare a submersible in Vesper Bay that you may make your approach.

It appears that Gaius possesses a means of breaching the security system of Castrum Marinum and entering via the dry dock. Once you arrive, however, there is a fairly high chance that you will be greeted by the enigmatic Emerald Weapon, so you had best be prepared for the worst.

※Castrum Marinum can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

The confrontation with the Emerald Weapon called on every last onze of mettle you could muster, and once the dust had settled, it was you that emerged the victor. Overlooking the wreckage is Gaius, who mourns the loss of its pilot Rex, one of the orphans he raised.

Following the battle, you are joined by Valdeaulin and Severa, whose mission to Castrum Occidens yielded little of value. After arriving in Castrum Marinum, they found Allie, another of Gaius's orphans, locked in a cell and decided to free her. She is filled with horror by the spectacle of the destroyed Emerald Weapon and descends into a state of shock. It seems the best recourse is to take her to Terncliff and allow her time to recover from the ordeal.

According to Severa, Allie's body is covered in welts and bruises that were most likely inflicted by the imperials under whom she served. Severa knows from personal experience the cruel treatment of those who are not pure-blooded Garleans, and she relates her tale of how she came to defect from the imperial army. Meanwhile, Allie continues to recuperate, and she may now be well enough to speak of what has befallen her and the other orphans, though it would be prudent to first discuss her current condition with Valdeaulin.

Allie has made great strides in recovering both physically and mentally, and is able to provide useful information on the present state of affairs and on Valens van Varro, legatus of the VIIth Legion. As she explains it, Valens is both jealous and cruel, and is willing to use any means at his disposal to achieve his goals, no matter how vile they may be. She also tells of Alfonse's dream of using the power granted to him by the Weapon project to break free from the Empire and establish a safe haven for those who wish to live in peace. Unfortunately, she is unable to say where he is, meaning that you will need to enlist the aid of the Alliance's scouts in locating him. With no immediate danger on the horizon, now seems an opportune time to return to the Resistance troops in Gyr Abania and report the latest series of events.

Your report is gratefully received by the Resistance officer in charge at Porta Praetoria. He will prepare a written copy of the information that has been gathered, should you wish to review it before being called into action once more.
objectives: Speak with the Ironworks pilot in Vesper Bay.
Confront the Emerald Weapon in Castrum Marinum.
Speak with the Resistance officer at Porta Praetoria.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Ah, it's good to see you, Forename.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to report that Master Garlond and the others uncovered a fair bit of useful information at the imperial facility in Terncliff.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: In fact, he'd like you to rendezvous with Gaius in the town square, where he'll reveal what they've found. Once you're ready to depart, your escort will lead the way.

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: All set for the journey ahead?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to Terncliff?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Now that you are here, perhaps Cid will finally deign to dispense his findings.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Severa, inform him of Forename's arrival.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Thanks for coming.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: So, what have you discovered?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: To tell the truth, we were lucky to obtain any information at all, considering the lengths to which the imperials went in covering their tracks. You see, the hangar below was not just used to store the Weapons, but played a critical role in their creation.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We now know the code names given to three of the Weapons. Ruby, Sapphire...and Emerald.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Obviously, we are all familiar with the first two, but the third is something of an unknown quantity.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: At the very least, this confirms the existence of another of those abominations.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: At the very least?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What are we waiting for? Let's go after it!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: The problem lies in ascertaining its whereabouts. None of the locals have seen anything resembling a Weapon being transported either by land or air.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Which of course leaves only one option: the sea. According to what fragmented data we were able to recover, the Emerald Weapon is equipped with aquatic capabilities, much like the Sapphire.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Meaning that its escape from Terncliff would have gone undetected, and could potentially be anywhere by now. But if Alfonse plans to have it absorb more primals...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: ...the logical choice would be Eorzea.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: And traveling by sea would allow him to circumvent the front line at Ghimlyt entirely! The Alliance must be alerted at once!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hold your chocobos, Severa. It seems that the Emerald Weapon was still incomplete when the VIIth Legion withdrew from Terncliff.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's far more likely that it was transported to another facility in order to add the finishing touches.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If your supposition is correct, that would narrow our search to but two possible locations: Castrum Marinum in the Rhotano Sea and Castrum Occidens in eastern La Noscea.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Both of which are known to harbor remnants of the XIVth Legion...your former subordinates, Gaius.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, our objective is unchanged. Valdeaulin, you and Severa will make your way to Castrum Occidens while Forename and I head for Castrum Marinum.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Should we locate the Emerald Weapon, we will give the signal to dispatch the G-Warrior and eliminate it before it can be activated.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Sorry to disappoint you, but we're still repairing the damage it sustained during the encounter with the Sapphire Weapon. While Allagan machinery has its uses, it's a bugger to find replacement parts in a pinch...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We've actually been working to expand its already impressive arsenal, but the G-Warrior itself is in no fit state for combat.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: While I'm aware this is a far from adequate replacement, I can provide an Ironworks submersible to help Forename and Gaius reach Castrum Marinum. I'll have one sent ahead to Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: A submersible, eh? I don't much like the sound of that. Perhaps Severa and I should count ourselves fortunate that our destination can be approached by land. I pray you have a safe journey. Watch yourself out there, Forename...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It is time we departed. Let us make our way to Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: It seems that Cid is not in the habit of saying the same thing twice, which must be why he has been waiting for you to arrive before revealing the results of his investigation.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Though the imperials may be gone, the scars they have left on this once-peaceful town will doubtless take many years to heal.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: I wouldn't mind going with you to Terncliff, but I've got to stay here to keep an eye on this horrible lot!

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: All set for the journey ahead?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to Terncliff?

dialogue.name: GSPILOT03980
dialogue.text: As per Master Garlond's instructions, the submersible is ready when you are!

dialogue.name: GSPILOT03980
dialogue.text: But before you depart, I've received some scraps of intelligence regarding your opponent from my colleagues in Terncliff.

dialogue.name: GSPILOT03980
dialogue.text: Apparently, it uses some sort of levitating...handlike appendages─six of them, in fact─though we're not quite sure what purpose they serve. It sounds like having eyes in the back of your head might come in handy. But that's all we know, I'm afraid.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You have our thanks. After all, forewarned is forearmed. If the Emerald Weapon has indeed been transported to this castrum, it would need to enter via the dry dock. We shall do likewise.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: As one might expect, there are measures in place to keep out intruders, but the security systems can be tricked into recognizing us as an imperial vessel.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: That said, infiltrating the facility is merely the first step...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Should the Emerald Weapon be activated, it is only a matter of time before the pilot uses Oversoul.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: We must silence the warmachina before this happens, and failing that, grant the poor soul at its helm the mercy of a swift death.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Had these wounds healed more quickly, I could have gone with you, but I fear I would only slow you down. As such, I shall provide what support I can from afar. Whatever happens, the Emerald Weapon must be defeated at all costs.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: In the event that my attempt to bypass the castrum's security fails, this submersible of Cid's had best be able to withstand imperial weaponry long enough for us to escape.

dialogue.name: GSPILOT03980
dialogue.text: I'm sorry we weren't able to provide any further details on the target. We can only guess what other tricks it might have in store for you. Be careful out there.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Though I would prefer that we avoid engaging my former wards in combat, we cannot allow my sentiments to prevent us from doing what must be done.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: And so it ends.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: But why would Rex throw away his life...for this!?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You are right... If I am ever to learn the truth, I must concentrate on the task at hand.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Of course, we do not need to wait for Cid's analysis to tell us whose combat data was used on this occasion.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It galls me to think that my techniques and strategies could be so closely replicated. Nevertheless, the observations I made during the battle may yet prove useful. As a matter of fact, that was not the only information I was able to gather.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I intercepted a signal that revealed the troops stationed here were permitted to withdraw, seemingly in return for assisting the VIIth Legion. They must have known that the Alliance would follow the Emerald Weapon here sooner or later and made good their escape.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Meaning the way is now clear for Cid to inspect the warmachina's remains.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We got here as soon as we could.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Not that we could've done anything to prevent this tragedy.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: From what we know, it seems that the Emerald Weapon was ilm for ilm a great deal more powerful than the previous two. If this is allowed to continue, who knows what sort of monstrosity the VIIth Legion will conceive next.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, Forename has once again proven herselfhimself capable of overcoming the worst the Empire has at its disposal.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: You may be relieved to hear that Castrum Occidens was free of anything resembling a Weapon. Unfortunately, it was also devoid of any useful leads, and we came away empty-handed.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: In all honesty, part of me wishes we had never found the Emerald Weapon. Perhaps then, Rex would not have been forced to make the ultimate sacrifice. I only hope that he is finally at peace...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We will do what we can to spare others from sharing his fate. I and the Ironworks will search this place from top to bottom for clues as to the VIIth Legion's plans.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Before that, allow me to sweep the area for booby traps and the like. I would not put it past the imperials to have left a few surprises for us...

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Agreed. I'll go with you.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: With that in mind, I'll begin my examination of the Emerald Weapon. Carefully, that is.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Alfonse! You knew all this time, didn't you!?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Milisandia and Ricon, too... Everyone except me.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: And you, Rex?

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: Yes. That's what the synthetic auracite system is. The fusion between pilot and core is the key to Oversoul.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: And unless we use it, we don't have a chance of beating Father's newfound friends. They stand between us and the primals, without which the Weapons will never reach their full potential. We thought that if you knew the truth about Oversoul, you'd try to stop us.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Of course I would! But what I don't understand is why all of you are so willing to give your lives for the Weapon project. What is it all for!?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: It all began the day Father left. Without his guidance, his protection, the Garleans lost any respect they once had for us.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: But their cruelty pales in comparison to Valens. To him, conscripts like us are expendable commodities, an endless supply of test subjects for his twisted experiments.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: But no matter what they do to us, we will never lose hope. If it is the duty of the strong to lead the weak, we will become strong and protect those who cannot protect themselves.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: The Weapon project will give us the strength we need. We will create a world where people like us can live without fear of persecution.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: We want you to see this new world for yourself, Allie. Even if we must give our lives to make it a reality.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: But...why me?

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: The years spent serving the Empire have changed us all...except you, Allie. Even after everything you've seen, you're still the caring, innocent girl we grew up with. More than any of us, you deserve a chance at happiness. That's what we all agreed.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Allie, listen to me. Right now, the soldiers assigned to watch over us have been called away to the capital. Now is our chance to get you out of here.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Then why don't you come with me!?

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: If Alfonse and I were to run away now, they'd only force others to take our place. We can't let that happen.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: This is our way of upholding the ideals Father instilled in us. Our lives are a small price to pay for Werlyt's freedom.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: No! How can you expect me to leave you behind!? I won't do it!

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: We will forever be at your side, Allie.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Rex, take her to the holding cells.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: No! Let me go!

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: So win or lose, the plan is to hand over the castrum to Father, is that right?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Yes. They'll take Allie into their custody before the Garleans return, while you will be free to pilot the Emerald Weapon without her interfering. We can't let her hinder the completion of the Weapon project.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: I'm counting on you, Alfonse. Don't let our sacrifices be in vain.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Rex, have you forgotten what I told you? You mustn't use Oversoul! I can't lose you too...

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: We both know I can't win without it. Besides, we need the combat data of the Emerald Weapon fighting at its peak if we're to have any chance of perfecting the synthetic auracite system. You know I'm not the sort to do things by halves.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Rex.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: Don't you worry about me. If this is where I meet my end, I'll do it with a smile on my face. The rest is up to you, Alfonse!

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: This is the girl you spoke of, yes? She was locked in a cell, but I saw no harm in letting her out. I can't say for certain, but it seems she's been through quite an ordeal.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: No...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Why, Rex!? Why!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...Gaius, once we've extracted the core, we'll take it back to Terncliff for analysis.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Perhaps she should come with us? There's no use in her staying here.

dialogue.name: GSPILOT03980
dialogue.text: We're still carrying out our search of Castrum Marinum. Would you like to take a look for yourself?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Enter Castrum Marinum?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Severa is taking care of Allie, but it may be some time until her nerves have settled.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If the vision you witnessed is indeed true, Alfonse and Rex locked her away for her own safety.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: When she is ready, I would know more of what her brother hopes to achieve and why he must resort to such desperate measures.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Allie's condition has improved somewhat, but she remains in a state of shock. We must give her more time to recover.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: There was one other thing that I thought you should know... When we checked her for injuries, we saw that her back is covered in welts and bruises.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Who did this to her!?

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: It seems she was subjected to beatings on a regular basis, judging by the varied stages of bruising. I daresay this was the work of her Garlean masters.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You speak as though you have seen this before...

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Seen? I have lived through it myself.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: I was born in Werlyt, twenty-three summers past.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: My mother was a local woman, but my father was a pure-blooded Garlean and a member of the occupying forces.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Though I know very little about him, his rank afforded me imperial citizenship. His acknowledgement of our familial ties was the extent of the responsibility he took for bringing me into this world. Still, it is more than can be said for most of his ilk...

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: My mother and I were shunned by the people of Werlyt, who treated us as badly as the Garleans did, if not worse. I thought that if I were to become an imperial soldier, my position might somehow deter those who would cast scorn on my mother, if only out of fear. And so I joined the army.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: The acceptance I earned was but temporary, however, and my superiors were quick to blame any perceived shortcomings on my “savage” lineage. Rather than waste time on official court-martials, they administered their own form of corporal punishment.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: I was eventually assigned to the XIIth Legion and fought under Zenos yae Galvus in Ala Mhigo. In the chaos that followed our defeat, I seized the opportunity to flee to Werlyt.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: While it was never much of a home, it was all I had. But nothing could prepare me for what awaited...

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: My mother had for many years suffered from poor health and relied on medicine to keep her alive. In my absence, the Garleans had denied her treatment, claiming that it would be wasted on savages. By the time I could return to her side, there was naught I could do.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: There was nothing left for me in Werlyt. I would be punished for desertion if the imperials discovered the reason for my return, and I was never accepted by my so-called countrymen to begin with.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: I ran as far as my legs could carry me. It was then that I met Gaius.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: So that is the truth of it... Other than a few scant details, I knew naught of your past. It sickens me to think that I once fought under the same banner as such vile creatures.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I had always believed it to be the duty of the strong to lead the weak. Yet there are those who become drunk on the power afforded by their station, and prey on the ones they should protect.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Like a canker, this corruption has spread to every part of the Empire.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Even those with Garlean blood, such as myself, are subjected to their cruelty. They hold particular contempt for the Au Ra, an easy target for abuse being so few in number. Perhaps, like me, Allie thought she would be spared such treatment once she joined the army. Alas...

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: I only hope that with time, Allie can put the past behind her and make a new life for herself. But for now, all we can do is wait for her delirium to subside. It is Valdeaulin's turn to keep watch. Let us ask him if there has been any change.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: I suppose you're here to ask about Allie.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Is she well enough to speak with us?

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: As her condition has improved somewhat, I would say so, provided you do not cause her any undue distress. Wait here.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Allie... I am sorry. What happened to Rex...it was my fault.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Milisandia, and Ricon, too... They died because of me and my foolish ambitions.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Father, no...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: This cannot go on. Please, Allie. You must tell me all you know.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Of course.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: First, I need to know what became of you and your siblings after we were parted.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: So much has happened, it seems like a lifetime ago... After your disappearance, we were all assigned to the newly reformed VIIth Legion.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: At first, each legatus was quickly replaced by the next, until eventually, a man named Valens van Varro was given command.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: He was sent from the capital, but before that, he was a specialist in experimental magitek weaponry.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: We later discovered that he was ordered by Emperor Varis to complete a project involving anti-primal warmachina: the Weapons... But after the Emperor's death, he was free to employ whatever methods he saw fit, and his greed for power only grew.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Some even say he is planning to use the power of the Weapons to lay claim to the throne.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: But I think there's another reason for his obsession with the Weapon project. Not that he'd ever tell anyone, but he's always muttering to himself, and I've been able to put the pieces together.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: He's jealous of you, Father.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Valens van Varro... I must admit, it was only recently that I first heard that name.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Valens used his knowledge of magitek to devise various military strategies. He was given a position in the army and quickly rose through the ranks.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: That was until one man stood in his way─ You, Father.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: He was one of the candidates to lead the new XIVth Legion, but that role fell to you. After that, he was assigned to serve under a far more gifted engineer, Nero, who was in charge of restoring the Ultima Weapon.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Valens has resented you ever since, going so far as to oppose the ideals you upheld. Where you treated those who serve the Empire based on merit rather than on their race or origin, Valens is adamant that pure-blooded Garleans are superior to all others.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: It never ceases to amaze me how far some will go in the name of revenge. All that hatred, festering away... Nothing good could ever come of it.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: So the marks on your body are his handiwork?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: ...Yes. To Valens and his men, we are no more than fodder for his experiments, playthings on which they can vent their frustrations. Every day is filled with nothing but pain...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If I had remained in Garlemald, you would never have been forced to endure this abuse.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: It's not your fault, Father. We could've fled from Valens if we'd wanted to. After all, we're expendable and easily replaced. The truth is, that's exactly why we couldn't run.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: In saving ourselves, we would be condemning others. But if we were to stay, to see the Weapon project to its completion, we would gain the power to defeat Valens, and then the Empire itself, freeing the world from its tyranny.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: That way, we might start afresh, and find a place we can call home. And not just for us, but for anyone who wishes to live in peace.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You would give your lives for a future you may not live to see...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: We took courage from your teachings, Father. The strong must lead the weak, and we would gain that strength by whatever means necessary. We will fight for the sake of those who cannot.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: But we knew that you'd never consent to our participation in the Weapon project, which is why we couldn't turn to you for help.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: As the pilots, we're the only ones who are able to stop Valens. We know just how powerful the Weapons are. He would use them to bring the world to its knees.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: And his “masterpiece” is the worst of them all...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: If only I could get my hands on it... Then I could save Alfonse and all of Werlyt!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Father, I know you and Alfonse stand on opposing sides of this conflict, but there must be some way you can help him.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: He may have called you our enemy before, but he never meant it. He still loves you, Father. You are everything he aspires to be.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I have failed him. Failed you all.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: But I refuse to abandon him to his fate. I will free him from Valens, if it is the last thing I do.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Thank you... He needs you. Now more than ever.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Listen, Allie. I once sought the strength to rebuild the world as I saw fit. But the Ultima Weapon was born not to create, but to destroy.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Alfonse must not follow in my footsteps. I know all too well where they lead.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I will do all I can to help your brother. Pray, tell me where he is.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: He's...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. I don't know where he could be.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: In that case, I shall have the Alliance dispatch scouts. Wherever he is, we will find him. As for you, Allie, you must stay here and rest.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Wait... You're the one who fought Rex, Ricon, and Milisandia, aren't you?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: We're the ones who threatened your homeland. You only did what you had to do.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: I have no right to ask this of you, but...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Lend my father your strength. Save Alfonse.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: ...I know now why they call you “hero.”

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Alfonse, I'll do what I must to free you, even if it means going against Father's wishes. But I have a good feeling about his new friend...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Severa, see that she has everything she needs.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Our allies must be informed of these troubling events. May I ask you to relay this news to the troops in Gyr Abania?

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Your “loving father” act may fool the others, Gaius, but not me. For every life you've saved, you've ended a thousand more. Or is this your idea of redemption?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Call it what you will. For all my transgressions, I believe I still have a part to play.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Was I wrong to spare you that day? Or will you honor your word? ...It seems the time has come for the Black Wolf to show his true colors.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Though you have overcome the Emerald Weapon, it is hardly cause for celebration. Another young life cut short...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Rex's death is on my hands, not yours. Would that this confrontation had been averted, but alas, it was not to be.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: We recently received word of your victory over the Emerald Weapon. I expect it was another fine display on your part, not that any of us were there to see it...

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: For that reason, we'd be grateful if you could give us a blow-by-blow account, if you wouldn't mind.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Good grief, it sounds like you had an awful lot to contend with! Rather you than me... Ahem! I shall add this to our ever-growing stack of reports, should anyone wish to review this information ahead of the next sortie.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Now, if I may say so, it looks like your ordeals have taken their toll. We'll let you know if anything requires your attention, but until then, be sure to get some rest!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, in the VIIth Legion's correction chamber...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Three Weapons. Three pitiful displays of ineptitude...

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Aghhh!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: To make matters worse, one of my prime candidates─your precious sister, no less─has escaped!

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Unnngh!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: And who should she go crawling to but that swine Gaius! After everything I've done t─for her, and this is how she repays me! As her older brother, it's your responsibility to instill some discipline in her, and you've failed miserably!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Well? Don't just stand there, boy.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Oh, of course! It's your first time, isn't it? Come along, there's no need to be shy.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: You see, something wicked has taken hold of this young man, and it's our job to cleanse his troubled spirit.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: It may look painful, but it's the only way, I assure you. He'll be ever so grateful, and you want him to get better, don't you?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: There's a good boy! Now, let's try again, shall we?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Burn out the bad! Burn out the bad!

dialogue.name: ELEZENBOY03980
dialogue.text: (-Elezen Ward-)B-Burn out the bad... Burn out the bad!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: (-Valens's Wards-)Burn out the bad! Burn out the bad!

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Gaaaaaagh!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Well done! You've all made Father proud. Very proud, indeed!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: As for you...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: I thought you were a cut above the rest of the savages, but it appears I was mistaken. And since you allowed that wretched sister of yours to escape, it falls to you to act as her replacement.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: I choose you as the next pilot, and your mission is simple: kill Gaius van Baelsar, whatever it takes. And if you so much as entertain the idea of betraying me again, I'll exterminate every last one of your kind...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: ...like the vermin they are!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Having said that, we will be forcibly initiating Oversoul using Zenos's combat data, so whatever schemes you may be hatching will never come to pass. All you need to do is sit back and let the synthetic auracite system do the work, with you as its conduit.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: You should thank me for allowing you to become part of my masterpiece. Your worthless existence will finally have some semblance of meaning!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Hehehe...

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: (-Valens's Second-in-command-)Lord Valens, preparations for the Oversoul trial are complete. We await your orders.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Splendid. There's never a dull moment around here!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Now then, boys. Who'd like to see something special?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Come along, everyone! Father has secrets to share with you!

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: This is my chance... And it's all thanks to the sacrifices made by my dear siblings. Finally, the Weapon will be mine to command.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Once it has reached perfection, I will be unstoppable. First Valens...then the Empire itself will fall, and we will be free at last.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Father...keep Allie safe.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Milisandia, Ricon, Rex... I'll see this through to the end. I promise.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Until then, watch over me.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: So? Is it ready or not?

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: The trial sequence has been primed, sir.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Then get on with it!

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: Initiating synthetic auracite system. Loading Diamond Weapon simulation.

dialogue.name: WERLYTPILOT03980
dialogue.text: Wh-What's going on!?

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: You're helping us with a little research is all, ah...whatever your name is. The time has come for you to contribute to the glory of Garlemald!

dialogue.name: WERLYTPILOT03980
dialogue.text: Th-This isn't what we agreed! You said th-that if I took part in the experiment, you'd let my f-family go!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: You have Zenos's data loaded, yes? Activate Oversoul, and be quick about it.

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: Understood, Lord Valens.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
(-VIIth Legion Senior Engineer-)Galvus combat sample ready.
Initiating organic core overwrite.

dialogue.name: WERLYTPILOT03980
dialogue.text: Nnnaaaaaaggghhh!

dialogue.name: WERLYTPILOT03980
dialogue.text:
My...mind is... Nooo!
If this is...what it takes to...protect you both...I...
I love you! I'm so sorry...!

dialogue.name: WERLYTPILOT03980
dialogue.text: Where...is my prey?

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: Organic core overwrite complete. Zenos yae Galvus data loaded.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Enough. Shut it down!

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: Deactivating synthetic auracite system.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Hmm... The subject is instinctively bound to seek out prey, right from the outset. Regardless of the combat prowess it may boast, I need an obedient servant, not a ravenous beast.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: How revolting! And what a mess it makes of the cockpit.

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Adjust the settings and prepare for another run! Fortunately, we have the next test subject ready and waiting...

dialogue.name: MECHANIC03980
dialogue.text: But sir, you agreed to release his family in exchange for his cooperation...

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Ahahahahahahaaaaaa!

dialogue.name: VALENSVANVARRO
dialogue.text: My, my! I never knew you had such a wonderful sense of humor! The great Valens van Varro, bargaining with savages? Ha! More fool him for trusting me in the first place!

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Leave Allie to me. Having cared for my mother for so long before being transferred away, I'd like to think I have developed suitable bedside manner.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: While I am painfully aware of the cruelty the Empire shows its enemies, even I am appalled to hear of how it treats its own. Warmachina that feed on the very lives of their pilots... I can scarcely imagine anything more heinous.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: The majority of the VIIth Legion are sure to be stationed in the city of Werlyt, the heart of this occupied territory. Whether Alfonse is there with them remains to be seen.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: According to Allie, another Weapon lies in wait, but where, we do not know. It stands to reason however, that if we were to find it, Alfonse would surely not be far away.
